items.impactStatement: The study of science itself is a growing field of research.

items.impactStatement: Tell us how the culture of research is changing.

items.impactStatement: eLife has published the following articles on SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19.

items.impactStatement: Research culture needs to be improved for the benefit of science and scientists.

thumbnail.alt: The Natural History of Model Organisms

items.impactStatement: Essays on the wild lives of model organisms, from Arabidopsis to the zebrafish.

items.title: Equity, Diversity and Inclusion

thumbnail.alt: Image of raised hands to represent diversity

items.impactStatement: The research community needs to do more to support scientists from underrepresented groups.

items.title: Living Science
items.impactStatement: Essays on the human side of science by Eve Marder.

items.title: Ion channels: A Collection of Articles
items.impactStatement: eLife has published papers on topics related to the molecular structure and functional mechanisms of a diverse array of ion channel proteins.

items.title: #ECRWednesday webinars
items.impactStatement: On the last Wednesday of each month, members of the eLife Early-Career Advisory Group invite experts to share their views and advice on subjects pertinent to research careers.

type.label: Associate features editor and web content manager

items.title: Executable Research Articles
items.impactStatement: eLife’s Executable Research Article lets authors include live code, data and interactive figures in their published paper.

items.title: Infectious Diseases: A Collection of Translational and Clinical Research Articles
items.impactStatement: eLife has published articles on a wide range of infectious diseases, including COVID-19, influenza, tuberculosis, HIV/AIDS, malaria and typhoid fever.

items.title: Evolutionary Medicine: A Special Issue
items.impactStatement: eLife is pleased to present a Special Issue to highlight recent advances in the growing and increasingly interdisciplinary field of evolutionary medicine.

items.title: Reproducibility Project: Cancer Biology
items.impactStatement: Investigating reproducibility in preclinical cancer research.

items.title: Mental Health in Academia
items.impactStatement: How can the scientific community support researchers with mental health issues?

items.title: Malaria: A Collection of Articles

thumbnail.alt: Mosquito infection by gametocytes from cultures exposed to dihydroartemisinin (DHA) from Figure 2, Portugaliza et al.

items.impactStatement: eLife has recently published a wide range of papers on malaria, covering a diversity of themes including parasite biology, epidemiology, immunology, drugs and vaccines.

items.title: Aging, Geroscience and Longevity: A Special Issue
items.impactStatement: eLife is pleased to present a Special Issue to highlight recent advances in the mechanistic understanding of aging and interventions that extend longevity.

items.title: Philosophy of Biology

thumbnail.alt: A series of articles on the philosophy of biology

items.impactStatement: A series of articles offering philosophical perspectives on the life sciences.

items.title: Quantitative Genetics: A Collection of Articles
items.impactStatement: eLife publishes advances in quantitative genetics, including the genetic basis of complex traits, the maintenance of genetic variation, and their roles in evolution.

items.title: Peer Review
items.impactStatement: A series of articles exploring how journals, funding agencies and universities review papers, grant applications and people.

items.title: Discovery and Translation of Cancer Immunology: A Special Issue
items.impactStatement: eLife is pleased to present a Special Issue to highlight recent advances in the mechanistic understanding of the immune response to cancer cells.

items.title: Scientist and Parent

thumbnail.alt: Parents and children work together to build a tower of blocks that feature images representing work and family activities that a scientist may take part in

items.impactStatement: A research career and family life are not incompatible.

items.title: Mechanistic Microbiome Studies: A Special Issue
items.impactStatement: eLife is pleased to present a Special Issue to highlight recent advances in the mechanistic understanding of microbiome function.

items.title: The Author's Story: A Series of Interviews
items.impactStatement: eLife authors answer questions about their life and work.

type.label: Associate features editor and web content manager

items.title: Plain-language Summaries of Research
items.impactStatement: A growing number of research journals, scientific societies, medical charities and other organizations are publishing summaries of research papers and proposals that explain their content in plain language.

items.title: Working Lives: A Series of Interviews
items.impactStatement: People with a PhD in the life sciences answer questions about their life and work.

type.label: Associate features editor and web content manager

items.title: Paleontology: A Collection of Articles
items.impactStatement: eLife has published papers on topics as diverse as paleoproteomics, ancient insects and the discovery of a new hominin species.

items.title: Tropical Disease: A Collection of Articles
items.impactStatement: eLife has published papers on many tropical diseases, including malaria, Ebola, leishmaniases, Dengue and African sleeping sickness.

items.title: Moving On: eLife at Five
items.impactStatement: To celebrate five years of eLife we catch up with some of our first authors and reflect on the current state of scientific publishing and peer review.

type.label: Associate features editor and web content manager
